intro: Pisum sativum var. unionis, commonly known as the runner bean, is a variant of the common pea plant. It is characterized by its long, trailing vines that produce edible pods containing seeds. The plant typically blooms with white or pink flowers, which are followed by the development of the bean pods. The leaves are compound, consisting of multiple oval-shaped leaflets. This variety is often cultivated for its nutritional value and is a popular choice in both home gardens and commercial agriculture.
